title: Elihu Defends God’s Justice
summary: Elihu rebukes Job for suggesting that God is unjust. He asserts that God always acts fairly, rewarding or punishing based on a person’s actions. God is accountable to no one but always does right.

faq.question: How does Elihu respond to Job’s complaints about injustice?
faq.answer: He insists that God cannot do wrong and repays everyone fairly.

faq.question: What warning does Elihu give Job?
faq.answer: Not to speak arrogantly or accuse God of wrongdoing.
